page.title: 19Bleak House Pub, Woking.
page.content: The Bleak House Public House stands almost alone on the Woking to Chertsey road. It is about 95 years old and has a garden and a large car park. The landlord who is there now has been there for about two and a half years. The pub serves light meals and bar snacks. Beer and lager are the most popular drinks. The regular customers mainly live in Woking but there is some passing trade as the road is very busy. It is mostly couples that come to the pub but there are a few more men. Summer is probably the busiest time of year because of the garden and Friday is the busiest day. The pub does small parties at Christmas and New Year. It is open daily from 10.30 to 2.30 and again from 5.30 to 11.00pm.
